modules.description: This module implements TLS client functionality for secure network communication, providing operations to create and manage TLS connections over Unix file descriptors. It supports creating TLS sockets with customizable read buffer sizes and ALPN protocols, upgrading existing connections to TLS, and shutting down or checking the state of connections. Concrete use cases include establishing HTTPS clients, securing WebSocket connections, and implementing custom encrypted network protocols.

This module implements SSL/TLS server functionality for handling secure network connections. It provides functions to create connection handlers that process incoming SSL sockets with customizable protocols and request handling logic, supporting operations like ALPN protocol negotiation during client upgrades. The module works directly with SSL sockets, Unix addresses, and file descriptors, enabling use cases such as building HTTPS servers or secure RPC endpoints with per-connection state management.

This module implements SSL/TLS client functionality for secure network communication. It provides operations to create and manage SSL sockets, including establishing connections, upgrading existing sockets with SSL, and shutting them down securely. The module works directly with Lwt_ssl.socket and integrates with file descriptors for low-level I/O operations.

This module handles TLS-secured network connections for servers, providing functions to create connection handlers that manage encrypted communication. It works with TLS sockets and Unix addresses, supporting protocol initialization and request handling for secure endpoints. Concrete use cases include setting up HTTPS servers with custom protocols and managing TLS upgrades on incoming connections.

This module implements client-side network communication over Unix file descriptors, providing operations to create and manage connections with customizable read buffer sizes and protocol handlers. It supports upgrading connections, checking connection state, and performing clean shutdowns, working directly with Lwt_unix.file_descr sockets. Concrete use cases include implementing HTTP/HTTPS clients, secure WebSocket transports, and custom network protocols with support for TLS and SSL encryption through its submodules.

This module implements network server functionality for handling incoming TCP connections using Lwt for asynchronous I/O. It provides functions to create connection handlers that process incoming sockets with customizable protocols and request handling logic, working directly with Unix addresses and file descriptors. Concrete use cases include building HTTP servers with per-connection state management and handling raw TCP protocols with configurable buffer sizes.

This module provides asynchronous network communication capabilities using Lwt and Unix file descriptors. It includes a server module for handling incoming TCP connections with customizable protocols and a client module for initiating connections and managing socket I/O with support for encryption. Use cases include building HTTP servers with per-connection state, implementing secure HTTP/HTTPS clients, and handling custom TCP-based protocols with TLS support.
